content:
# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

This section outlines which versions of HyperCode are currently supported with security updates.

| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 1.0.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| < 1.0   | :x:                |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

We take the security of HyperCode seriously. We appreciate your efforts to responsibly disclose your findings, and will make every effort to acknowledge your contributions.

To report a security vulnerability, please use the **Private Vulnerability Reporting** feature on GitHub. This is the most secure and efficient way to report a vulnerability.

1.  Navigate to the [Security tab](https://github.com/welshDog/hypercode/security) of the HyperCode repository.
2.  Click on "Report a vulnerability".
3.  Fill out the form with the necessary details, including a description of the vulnerability, steps to reproduce it, and its potential impact.

**Please do not report security vulnerabilities through public GitHub issues.**

**(Note to project maintainers: To enable this feature, go to your repository's "Settings" > "Code security and analysis" and enable "Private vulnerability reporting".)**

We will acknowledge your report within 48 hours and will work with you to understand and resolve the issue.

## Disclosure Policy

After a security vulnerability has been reported, we will coordinate with the reporter on a timeline for public disclosure. We prefer to fully disclose the vulnerability once a fix has been released. We will credit the reporter for their discovery unless they prefer to remain anonymous.
